title: Is it 'the same exact thing', “the exact same thing”, or 'exactly the same thing'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is it "the same exact thing", “the exact same thing”, or "exactly the same thing"? Here in the UK we would generally say “exactly the same thing”; I hear “the exact same thing” more from Americans. I have to be honest and admit that I am not sure whether “the exact same thing” is, strictly speaking, grammatical, but it has become so ingrained in Americans’ every day speech that it doesn’t even sound wrong to me.
In one sense, it doesn't matter. Same means equal, not almost equal, not approximately equal, not a vanishingly tiny bit short of equal, but equal. The same thing is a perfectly adequate phrase.
